programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Clover

programme.title: Klippers

programme.title: Love Won't Let Me Wait

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.title: The Walk of Rufus
programme.desc: A kingpin named Rufus takes over the family empire running the streets of Chicago, but the change in lieutenant comes with a price.

programme.title: The Wake Up Call
programme.desc: Upon learning of his father’s cancer diagnosis, a gifted research student dedicates every waking hour to finding a cure.

programme.title: The Foreign Exchange Student
programme.desc: A troubled high schooler is sent to America on exchange when she is suspected of murder, but soon wreaks havoc on her host family.

programme.title: The Foreign Exchange Student 2:The Hunt
programme.desc: Mr. and Mrs. Nelson are excited to be getting two new foreign exchange students to live with them. Then, a chain of murders starts to happen again in the city of Houston. They suspect the murders may be connected to Sinclair's death.

programme.title: Saints 2 Aints
programme.desc: Chiffona hopes to reconnect with Orvalle, her former sweetheart, but her lifelong friend Gevia is desperately trying to steal him for herself.

programme.title: Plain Sight
programme.desc: An exotic dancer is determined to build her own empire and create a better life for her and her brother, then someone threatens to destroy her plans.

programme.title: Never Too Far Away
programme.desc: Cierra Flowers, an exotic dancer with a sordid and complicated past, moves to a small town where she meets a man who is already involved.

programme.title: 1-800 Missing
programme.desc: After his daughter goes missing, Kevin Townsend, an undercover cop, makes it his mission to save her and the missing children of Chicago.

programme.title: Sugar Daddy Killer
programme.desc: Sasha has just ended a relationship with her boyfriend and is looking for a fresh start. Her friend Tonya tells her she needs to get a Sugar Daddy to forget about her boyfriend, and get her bills paid. Sasha starts dating a Sugar Daddy and decides she is going to scam him. When Sasha's Sugar Daddy wants more than conversation, she is forced to kill him. Now Sasha decides to start killing one Sugar Daddy after the next to get all the money she can.

programme.title: Cut
programme.desc: A claustrophobic thrill ride, only relenting on its increasingly unbearable tension and heart stopping shocks, to inject a little humor to soften the blow and increase the fun!

programme.title: Smoke Break
programme.desc: A barber and his crew work together to save their shop after another ordinary day on the job is suddenly sent off course by a robbery.

programme.title: Bloodlines
programme.desc: Sydney Carter is a restless college student that has always felt out of place. When she discovers she's adopted, her world beings to unravel, and she embarks on a journey to discover her origins, but they come at a cost, and could destroy everything she's ever known.

programme.title: Priceless: The Score
programme.desc: After starting their new record label, Donica Blair and Shequell Harris have entered a dangerous arena full of guns, lies, and deceit. Now they are racing against time to right their wrongs and save their own lives before they are next in a string of murders. Meanwhile their partner Seven, has fallen victim to the deadliest of them all; the Black widow.

programme.title: The Walk of Rufus 2: Theodis
programme.desc: Theodis and Rufus are brothers who grow up to become powerful Chicago Kingpins. When rufus is murdered, Theodis sets out on a path of revenge making those responsible for his brother's death pay a high price.

programme.title: Suppress
programme.desc: A teen attempts to get his parents to divorce in order to go to college in New York with his girlfriend.

programme.title: Loyalty
programme.desc: An independent drug dealer learns his girlfriend used to date his competitor and believes they might still be messing around.

programme.title: Loyalty 2 the Return of T Bone
programme.desc: After making bail, the notorious killer and drug lord T Bone returns to the streets of Harlem, NY to clean up the family business and tie all loose ends. But once again the tables are turned when T Bone is betrayed by someone close.

programme.title: Killer Baby Mama
programme.desc: Calvin and Erica's tumultuous relationship takes a turn when Erica discovers she's pregnant. Unhappy with the news, Calvin decides to break up with her, moving on to date Candace. Meanwhile, Erica befriends Calvin's sick mother to gather information.

programme.title: Induced
programme.desc: An expectant couple heads to a remote cabin to have a natural childbirth, but comes under attack from a predatory midwife who will stop at nothing to snatch their unborn child from them.

programme.title: Hidden Secrets
programme.desc: Loyalties are tested and bonds are broken across eight unique stories as devastating secrets come to light for people unprepared to face them.

programme.title: Fractured
programme.desc: A thrilling narrative that follows a woman’s struggle to keep her life together after discovering that her husband has been unfaithful.

programme.title: Fall Semester
programme.desc: Kid Kypree is a college student with dreams and ambitions of becoming the next great stand-up comic. One night he gets invited to a party hosted by an old friend that throws into a whirlwind of challenges that will test his mettle and sense of humor.

programme.title: Swept

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Werewolf" (1996) Horror. Members of an isolated desert community become beasts when the moon is full.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Crops thrive on irradiated soil -- so do grasshoppers.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Zindy the Swamp Boy
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew returns to René Cardona Jr.’s oeuvre with this 1973 tale of a prepubescent fugitive flautist who makes you root for killer pumas.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: After a devastating atomic test, Joseph Javorsky, a defecting Russian scientist, is transformed into a murderous radioactive beast. Can desert patrolmen Jim Archer and Joe Dobson stop the creature before it kills again?

programme.title: The Film Crew: The Giant of Marathon
programme.desc: The Film Crew continue their thankless task of reviewing the best worst movies with the 1959 war woozy The Giant of Marathon.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Warrior of the Lost World" (1983) Science fiction. An anonymous warrior on a supersonic cycle saves a girl and her father from a tyrant.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Wild Rebels" (1967) Action. An auto racer poses as getaway driver for outlaw bikers. With Steve Alaimo, Willie Pastrano, John Vella.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Deathstalker and the Warriors From Hell" a k a "Deathstalker III" (1989) Fantasy. A medieval hero (John Allen Nelson) meets twin princesses (Carla Herd) on a diamond quest.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Painted Hills" (1951) Adventure. A collie, played by Lassie, avenges its gold-miner master.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Supernatural occurrences lead a former mental patient to believe that someone or something is after her inheritance in "The Screaming Skull.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Catalina Caper" (1967) Collegians track art thieves and attend beach parties. With Tommy Kirk, Del Moore, Peter Duryea.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time of the Apes" (1987) Science fiction. Two children and a frozen woman wake up 2,000 years later, when apes and a computer rule the world. With Reiko Tokunaga, Hiroko Saito, Masaaki Kaji.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Three coffee shop customers help an owner rob an armored car.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Painted Hills" (1951) Adventure. A collie, played by Lassie, avenges its gold-miner master.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Daddy-O" (1959) Crime drama. Hoodlums want a singing truck driver to drive their getaway car. With Dick Contino, Sandra Giles, Bruno VeSota.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Counterintelligence takes on a new meaning in this barely coherent tale of Hawaiian espionage that takes place on movie sets meant to look like Hawaii.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Robot vs. the Aztec Mummy" (1959) Horror. Mad Dr. Krupp sends his homemade robot to rob the treasure of a Mexican mummy's tomb. With Ramon Gay, Rosita Arenas, Crox Alvarado.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: American spies discover the Chinese have built a weapon capable of destroying the Earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A secret organization called Mighty Jack (1968) uses a submarine to battle a terrorist organization. Joel and the Bots make a Mighty Jack pet food commercial and sing the song "Slow The Plot Down!".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew watches "The Magic Voyage of Sinbad," where a sea-going adventurer sets sail to find the bluebird of happiness, which he believes will help his down-on-its-luck hometown.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew stages their own moon landing pageant as they watch the film Moon Zero Two (1969) about an astronaut hired to capture an asteroid made of sapphires.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Guiron" (1969) Science fiction. Flying turtle Gamera spins to the far side of the sun and meets a pointy-headed monster and women who like brains. With Nobuhiro Kashima, Christopher Murphy, Miyuki Akiyama.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.desc: Guest judge Richard Blais enters the kitchen to see what the kids can cook up. In the first challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks team up into groups of three and have 10 minutes to make as many pies as possible. For the next challenge, the young chefs must use a blow torch to make either an appetizer, entrée, or dessert using ingredients from the MASTERCHEF pantry. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home?

Taking on a dead man's identity, he moves to an upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles and sets his sights on local woman Carol (Meg Foster), slowly winning her heart. Carol's son, Todd (Jonathan Brandis), grows suspicious of his mom's new lover, however, and tensions reach the boiling point at the couple's wedding.

programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, enjoying the colours of late summer in the garden. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Frances Tophill get an exclusive preview of Gardeners' World Live at the NEC.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow with plenty of seasonal advice to keep gardens colourful. Will Young shows off his south London courtyard garden and reveals why it has become an absolute joy in his life, and Joe Swift helps him create some seasonal pot displays for sunny and shady spots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets some shrubs in the ground and plans ahead for spring with some bulb planting. Meanwhile, Frances Tophill joins Sue Kent on her allotment to find out how her growing year has been.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam in his garden for a seasonal catch-up. Toby Buckland gives timely tips on summer and autumn maintenance for borders, plus join singer-songwriter Billie Marten as she shares her passion for growing vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into more seasonal tasks. Joe Swift heads to Houghton Lodge Gardens in Hampshire renowned for its walled kitchen garden and heritage fruit collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. Carol Klein visits comedian Joe Lycett at home, and together, they plant up a container packed with layers of colourful bulbs. Toby Buckland visits Sue Kent's garden near Swansea to help out with autumnal maintenance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and team share the best practical gardening advice, meet passionate plants-people up and down the country, and provide inspiration with visits to some of the UK's most remarkable gardens.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa
programme.desc: Full review of the 2025 Corvette ZR1.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE: Dan Gurney's Chevy Impala Returned to the Family After 63 Years

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rolls Royces, Tri-Five Chevys, and vintage Volkswagens

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Embark on an epic journey into the world of legendary snook fishing with 'Legendary Snook Chronicles: Captain Mike Anderson's Reel Odyssey.' Join the seasoned angler, Captain Mike Anderson, as he takes you on an adrenaline-pumping adventure through the waters, revealing the secrets of reeling in these elusive giants.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike shares Tampa Bay's secrets with young anglers of his Jr. Pro Staff team, teaching the importance of patience and respect an angler. The smiles on their faces are lasting proof of how rewarding it can be to bring up the next generation.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Return to the Redfish Haven. Armed with Strike King lures, Mike and his team embark on an exciting angling adventure, targeting massive redfish in the Louisiana Delta. Don't miss this thrilling journey through challenging waters and breathtaking landscapes in pursuit of the ultimate Bayou beast.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara spend the last night of the year on the ice chasing crappies after dark!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara head north to Cliff Lake in NW Ontario. Cliff is known for its smallie fishing and the pre-spawn bite does not disappoint.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by John McCune for blue line fishing with Tad Murdock. Later they explore Helen Georgia during Oktoberfest.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins Capt. Tucker Ersek and his father for a day of sail fishing off Ocean Reef in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared makes his way to Bolivar, Texas with Clay Guest & Ryan Pyburn.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins legendary Captains Donny Lange and Charlie Scoble offshore in Islamorada.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didn’t think so. Let’s discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: After booking a trip at the last Indian River Clam Restoration banquete, the guys at Gold Key Roofing got a chance to fish with Capt. Blair and Capt. Mike Frenette.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, David Genat is cruising the Caribbean through the US and British Virgin Islands before finishing up in colorful and vibrant Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: On a mission to clean up Ohio's leaking, abandoned coal mines, Ohio University Art Professor John Sabraw teams up with an environmental engineer to develop a process that turns the toxic runoff pollution into desirable oil paints. John’s artwork has been shown all over the world and proceeds have helped numerous environmental organizations and projects, including a new water treatment plant on the Sunday Creek watershed in southeastern Ohio.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: This spring, Rivers are Life proudly partnered with The Little Forks Conservancy for a stream sampling event along Michigan’s Cedar River—a vital part of the watershed that eventually flows into Saginaw Bay.Held on May 17 at the Gladwin Conservation District’s Community Garden, the event brought together Citizen Scientists from across the state. Volunteers were divided into teams and sent to six different sites along the river to collect insect nymphs and larvae—tiny but mighty indicators of water health.Over 223 specimens were gathered, from stoneflies and mayflies to dragonfly larvae. These macroinvertebrates are highly sensitive to their environment, and their presence (or absence) can tell us a lot about the state of the river.The results? Based on initial identifications, the Cedar River shows signs of excellent water quality—making it one of Michigan’s prized Blue Ribbon Trout Streams.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Veteran Army Pilot, Stephanie Garcia, hunts for an axis buck as part of the Bucks for the Brave program.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take their brand new Invincible 36’ out of Plantation Boat Mart to fly the kites for some early season sailfishing

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36’into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Get ready to embark on an exhilarating fishing expedition as Mike Anderson, the renowned host of Reel Animals TV, teams up with two dynamic and skilled female captains, Katie Jo and Lezia Fitzgerald, on the stunning Nature Coast of Florida.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Embark on an epic journey into the world of legendary snook fishing with 'Legendary Snook Chronicles: Captain Mike Anderson's Reel Odyssey.' Join the seasoned angler, Captain Mike Anderson, as he takes you on an adrenaline-pumping adventure through the waters, revealing the secrets of reeling in these elusive giants.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didn’t think so. Let’s discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! programme.title: Local Knowledge

Volunteers were divided into teams and sent to six different sites along the river to collect insect nymphs and larvae—tiny but mighty indicators of water health.Over 223 specimens were gathered, from stoneflies and mayflies to dragonfly larvae. These macroinvertebrates are highly sensitive to their environment, and their presence (or absence) can tell us a lot about the state of the river.The results? Based on initial identifications, the Cedar River shows signs of excellent water quality—making it one of Michigan’s prized Blue Ribbon Trout Streams.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Veteran Army Pilot, Stephanie Garcia, hunts for an axis buck as part of the Bucks for the Brave program.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Embark on an epic journey into the world of legendary snook fishing with 'Legendary Snook Chronicles: Captain Mike Anderson's Reel Odyssey.' Join the seasoned angler, Captain Mike Anderson, as he takes you on an adrenaline-pumping adventure through the waters, revealing the secrets of reeling in these elusive giants.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.desc: Captain Solomon Kane (James Purefoy) is a brutally efficient 16th Century killing machine.

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A mortal tries to save the world and his own true love by joining with a powerful god in an epic battle against his rival, the deadly god of darkness.

programme.title: Horns
programme.desc: After his girlfriend's mysterious death, a young man awakens to find strange horns sprouting from his forehead

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Two hearts and two worlds collide when high school student Bella Swan falls in love with Edward Cullen, a 108-year-old vampire.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Separated from Edward, Bella begins a friendship with Jacob who leads her deeper into the supernatural, in this second film in the Twilight series.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third film in the Twilight franchise. Torn between Edward and Jacob, Bella must also confront a vengeful vampire and a string of grisly murders.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: The Quileutes close in on Edward and Bella, whose unborn child poses a threat to the Wolf Pack and Forks.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The Cullens gather together other vampire clans in order to protect Renesmee from a false allegation.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Two hearts and two worlds collide when high school student Bella Swan falls in love with Edward Cullen, a 108-year-old vampire.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Separated from Edward, Bella begins a friendship with Jacob who leads her deeper into the supernatural, in this second film in the Twilight series.
